words.english_definition: an arrangement for a meeting at a given time and place

example_sentence.english: If you would like to meet with Mr. Higgins, you must first make an appointment with his secretary.
example_sentence.chinese: 如果想见金斯先生，您得先跟他的秘书约好时间。

words.english_definition: the act of being present; the number of persons present

example_sentence.english: I was very pleased with the number of high-ranking officials in attendance at today’s press conference.
example_sentence.chinese: 我很高兴今天的新闻发布会有这么多高级官员到场。

words.english_definition: an upright case or cupboard with shelves, drawers, or compartments for safekeeping or display of objects

example_sentence.english: He keeps all his files in the cabinets in the back of the office.
example_sentence.chinese: 他把所有文件都放在办公室后面的柜子里。

words.english_definition: a chart showing the months of a year (including days and weeks); a schedule

example_sentence.english: Please check the calendar on the wall and see which date Mother’s Day falls on this year.
example_sentence.chinese: 请查看墙上的日历，看看今年的母亲节是几号。

words.english_definition: a person who works in an office, bank, or law court and whose job is to look after records or accounts

example_sentence.english: She was offered a job as an accounts clerk with a travel firm.
example_sentence.chinese: 一家旅行社聘用她当会计。

words.english_definition: an alphabetical or classified list of names and addresses

example_sentence.english: If you need to speak to him, you can use the office directory and look up his personal extension.
example_sentence.chinese: 如果你需要跟他说话，你可以用办公室的名册查出他的分机号码。

words.english_definition: an identical copy

example_sentence.english: Please don’t bring a duplicate, since I will need to see your original birth certificate for this passport.
example_sentence.chinese: 办理护照时，我需要看你的出生证明正本，所以不要带影印本。

words.english_definition: putting in useful order; cataloguing

example_sentence.english: Developed in the early 1900’s, the Dewey Decimal System is a filing system still used by libraries today.
example_sentence.chinese: 在20世纪初期发明的杜威十进制分类系统至今仍为许多图书馆所使用。

words.english_definition: a flat, shallow container used for holding items that are to be accomplished

example_sentence.english: The more Dennis procrastinated, the more the stack of paperwork in his in-tray resembled the Rocky Mountains.
example_sentence.chinese: 丹尼斯越是拖延，他的“待处理文件盒”里的文件堆就越像落基山脉。

words.english_definition: to watch, or keep track of, often by means of an electronic device

example_sentence.english: Seismic readouts are carefully monitored by seismologists, who are always on the lookout for the next big earthquake.
example_sentence.chinese: 地震学家密切监控地震读数，以随时准备应对下一次大地震。

words.english_definition: a tray or shallow basket used in offices to put letters and documents in when they have been dealt with

example_sentence.english: I will leave that file in my out-tray on my desk, and you can come pick it up anytime in the afternoon.
example_sentence.chinese: 我会把那份文件放在桌上的“已处理文件盒”里，你可以在下午的任何时间来取。

words.english_definition: division into parts; something that separates or divides, as a wall

example_sentence.english: We don’t have the money to add an entirely new office, but what we can do is add a partition and divide one or two of the larger offices into multiple smaller ones.
example_sentence.chinese: 我们没有足够的钱建一间全新的办公室，但是我们可以用隔板将一两间较大的办公室分成较小的办公空间。

words.english_definition: the charge for mailing an item

example_sentence.english: How much postage is required for a small package to be sent to Hong Kong?
example_sentence.chinese: 寄一个小包裹到香港需要多少邮费？

words.english_definition: the quality or state of observing an appointed or regular time

example_sentence.english: In addition to your dress and appearance, punctuality and a concise delivery are very important in a job interview.
example_sentence.chinese: 除了穿着和外貌外，准时和简洁的表达在求职面试中也非常重要。

words.english_definition: a plan that gives a list of events or tasks and the times at which each one should happen or be done

example_sentence.english: The plane arrived in Cairo four minutes ahead of schedule.
example_sentence.chinese: 飞机比预定时间早了4分钟到达开罗。

words.english_definition: a person’s scheduled period of work

example_sentence.english: They often heard him complain about having to work the graveyard shift in order to pay the bills.
example_sentence.chinese: 他们经常听到他抱怨为了支付账单必须值夜班。

words.english_definition: the personnel of an enterprise

example_sentence.english: The staff at the five-star Formosa Hotel delivers prompt and friendly service.
example_sentence.chinese: 五星级福尔摩沙酒店的员工非常及时、周到。

words.english_definition: a stoppage of work for a period of time by workers, usually in order to try to get better pay benefits or other conditions for themselves

example_sentence.english: I’m glad that our employees were satisfied and didn’t find the need for a strike to express their concerns.
example_sentence.chinese: 我很高兴我们的员工都很满意，觉得没有必要罢工来表达他们的关切。

words.english_definition: a piece of assigned work

example_sentence.english: This task must be made top priority because a very important client wants to pick up these papers today.
example_sentence.chinese: 这项任务被优先安排，因为有一个非常重要的客户今天要来取这些文件。

words.english_definition: the total number of workers employed in a specific project; the total number of persons employed

example_sentence.english: After months of unemployment, Tim joined the American workforce as the night manager at KFC.
example_sentence.chinese: 失业几个月后，提姆加入了美国劳动力队伍，开始在肯德基担任夜班经理。
